properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A further 5 cm of snowfall will fall this morning mainly over higher terrain. A frontal system will remain draped across the Chilcotin-Cariboo-100 Mile region today but temperatures are forecast to warm a few degrees above zero this afternoon so snow should turn to rain by mid-day. Rain may turn back to snow again overnight and early Thursday morning but accumulations are not expected to be significant. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-28T22:06:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-28T12:26:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3986927417.2020
Area: Highway 97 - Clinton to 100 Mile House via Begbie Summit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long episode of heavy rain continues. A Pacific front has stalled over the central coast and is expected to remain over the area today and Thursday morning. The front will move northward on Thursday as a low pressure system approaches. Another brief period of heavy rain will potentially occur Thursday night as the low moves inland. So far, at Bella Coola near 70 mm of rain has fallen and near 100 mm has fallen over some coastal areas. Rain, at times heavy, will continue through Thursday morning. Total rainfall amounts for the system will likely reach near 250 mm over the coast and about 150 mm inland. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-29T04:02:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-28T12:03:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2667295810.2020
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections, Central Coast - inland sections
